title: cited together as the Building Regulations 1997 to 2022 and shall be construed
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (District
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (District 

Heating) Regulations 2022. 

(2) The Building Regulations 1997 to 2021 and these Regulations may be 
cited together as the Building Regulations 1997 to 2022 and shall be construed 
together as one. 

Definition
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited european union (district heating) regulation 2022 (2) building regulation 1997 2021 regulation may cited together building regulation 1997 2022 shall construed together one definition

title: cited together as the Building Regulations 1997 to 2022 and shall be construed
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations – 

“Directive” means Directive (EU) 2018/2001 of the European Parliament and 
of the Council of 11 December 20181 on the promotion of the use of energy 
from renewable sources; 

“efficient district heating and cooling” means a district heating or cooling 
system using at least – 

(a) 
(b) 
(c) 
(d) 

50% renewable energy, 
50% waste heat, 
75% cogenerated heat, or 
50% of a combination of such energy and heat. 

(2) A word or expression used in these Regulations and which is also used 
in the Directive has, unless the context otherwise requires, the same meaning in 
these Regulations as it has in that Directive.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation - directive mean directive (eu) 2018 2001 european parliament council 11 december 20181 promotion use energy renewable source efficient district heating cooling mean district heating cooling system using least - (a) (b) (c) (d) 50 renewable energy 50 waste heat 75 cogenerated heat 50 combination energy heat (2) word expression used regulation also used directive unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation directive

title: cited together as the Building Regulations 1997 to 2022 and shall be construed
heading: 3. The minimum levels of energy from renewable sources, referred to in
text_raw:
3. The minimum levels of energy from renewable sources, referred to in 
Article 15(4) of the Directive, may be fulfilled through efficient district heating 
and cooling using a significant share of renewable energy and waste heat and 
cold. 

1 OJ No. L 328, 21.12.2018, p. 82. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 28th October, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [534] 3 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

25 October, 2022. 

DARRAGH O’BRIEN, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage.
